page.title: 06Arts/crafts in Glastonbury
page.content: Glastonbury attracts many{professional and{amateur artists,}who paint various views of the Tor.{John Morland}is well known for his paintings and prints of local scenes and nature.{F.A.C.E.}has been set up as a workshop and display centre for local craftsmen. Several professional potters work from their home. Exhibitions are held by the Hexagon Art Group and other artists at the{Ark (part of Glastonbury Experience), and the{Rural Life Museum.}Also held here are demonstrations including:spinning, woodturning,thatching,tatting,silver- work,enamelling,butter,cheese,cider, lace and basket making,and rush and canework. The{W.I.}support arts and crafts such as:china painting,patchwork,lampshade and cracker making,crochet,macrame and flower pressing.
